docs.lead_paragraph: My recent post on my health insurance rates brought some interesting comments. I'd like to respond to a few and share some further thoughts.
docs.abstract: I think we would have a more dynamic labor market if health care were decoupled from employment.
docs.snippet: I think we would have a more dynamic labor market if health care were decoupled from employment.

docs.lead_paragraph: In The Times:- The Obama administration plans to reward more than $206 million to 15 states for signing up children who are eligible for public health insurance but had previously failed to enroll, Kevin Sack reports.- Sewell Chan anticipates the impact four regional bank presidents of the Federal Reserve might have on the central bank's monetary policy decisions when they become voting members of the Federal Open Market Committee next year.- In Al Hunt's Letter from Washington, two retiring Democratic Senators - David R. Obey and Christopher J. Dodd - lament the growing polarization of Congress.- Bill Carter and Brian Stelter liken the comedian Jon Stewart's role in propelling the 9/11 health care bill to passage to heroic advocacy efforts by Edward Murrow and Walter Cronkite. - Piles of Soviet-era trucks that had indicated - to Gulf Coast conspiracy theorists - a plan by the United Nations to overthrow the United States government landed in a scrap yard this fall, where they will be melted down and reincarnated. Campbell Robertson dug up the story behind the Soviet vehicles and how they ended up in Gulfport, Miss.

docs.lead_paragraph: SIMON--Leonard S. The Board and Staff of Volunteers In Medicine-Berkshires mourn with great sadness the untimely passing of our founder, friend and colleague on December 24, 2010. We join with our volunteers and patients to offer our most heartfelt condolences to his wife, Marion, sons Andrew and Jon and their families. Leonard's vision, leadership, passion, dedication and generosity have been instrumental in bringing free health care services to those without insurance or the ability to pay. His legacy will serve as an inspiration to all of us to continue his endeavors. Arthur M. Peisner, Chairman Board of Trustees Volunteers In Medicine- Berkshires

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SIMON, LEONARD S.
